97559.name: Minutes spent sleeping (MTUS (2013))
97559.description: Average minutes spent sleep and naps per day. Average minutes spent in different activities includes both weekdays and weekends.
97559.datasetName: Multinational Time Use Study (MTUS) - Gershuny and Fisher (2013)

source.name: Multinational Time Use Study
source.dataPublishedBy: Jonathan Gershuny and Kimberly Fisher. (2013) Multinational Time Use Study. Centre for Time Use Research, University of Oxford.
source.additionalInfo:
The Multinational Time Use Study (MTUS) compiles a cross-nationally harmonised set of time use surveys where recorded variables are comparably recoded. Activities are sorted into 25 categories for the population aged between 21-65. We restrict our sample to working-age adults to minimise the role of time allocation decisions with a strong inter-temporal component. The following methodology was used to arrive at the minutes spent across the 25 recorded activities:
  • Using the MTUS simple dataset, the sample was restricted to individuals aged between 15-64.
  • The minutes spent on each activity were weighted by the ‘propwt’ variable which brings the sample in line with the population from which it was drawn and ensures only good quality diaries are used. More information on the construction of ‘propwt’ can be found here: https://www.timeuse.org/sites/default/files/9727/chapter-5-weights-in-mtus.pdf
  • To calculate the mean number of minutes spent on an activity in a country in a given year, we took an average of the number of minutes spent on each of the 25 activities reported by the diarists. All diary entries where no minutes are recorded for certain activity are treated as missing and are not included in the calculated average.
  • The data is normalised to 1440 minutes per day. In other words, for those countries for which the time use does not sum up to 1440 minutes after weighting and averaging, the missing minutes are equally distributed across all activities.
Please see Table 1.1 for a list of all the surveys and years included: https://www.timeuse.org/sites/default/files/9727/mtus-user-guide-r9-february-2016.pdf

97560.name: Minutes spent eating and drinking (MTUS (2013))
97560.description: Average minutes spent eating and drinking per day, includes meals at work or school. Average minutes spent in different activities includes both weekdays and weekends.
97560.datasetName: Multinational Time Use Study (MTUS) - Gershuny and Fisher (2013)

  • The minutes spent on each activity were weighted by the ‘propwt’ variable which brings the sample in line with the population from which it was drawn and ensures only good quality diaries are used. More information on the construction of ‘propwt’ can be found here: https://www.timeuse.org/sites/default/files/9727/chapter-5-weights-in-mtus.pdf
  • To calculate the mean number of minutes spent on an activity in a country in a given year, we took an average of the number of minutes spent on each of the 25 activities reported by the diarists. 97561.name: Minutes spent on self care (MTUS (2013))
97561.description: Average minutes spent on self care, including activities such as washing, dressing, and caring for oneself. Average minutes spent in different activities includes both weekdays and weekends.

97562.name: Minutes spent on paid work (MTUS (2013))
97562.description: Average minutes spent on paid work. This includes paid work for one's paid job (not at home), paid work at home (main, second, or other job), unpaid work to generate household income, travel as part of work, work breaks, other time at workplace, and looking for work. Average minutes spent in different activities includes both weekdays and weekends.
97562.datasetName: Multinational Time Use Study (MTUS) - Gershuny and Fisher (2013)

97574.name: Minutes spent on voluntary work (MTUS (2013))
97574.description: Average minutes spent on voluntary work. This includes civic or organisational activity. Average minutes spent in different activities includes both weekdays and weekends.
97574.datasetName: Multinational Time Use Study (MTUS) - Gershuny and Fisher (2013)

source.name: Multinational Time Use Study
source.dataPublishedBy: Jonathan Gershuny and Kimberly Fisher. (2013) Multinational Time Use Study. Centre for Time Use Research, University of Oxford.
source.additionalInfo:
The Multinational Time Use Study (MTUS) compiles a cross-nationally harmonised set of time use surveys where recorded variables are comparably recoded. Activities are sorted into 25 categories for the population aged between 21-65. We restrict our sample to working-age adults to minimise the role of time allocation decisions with a strong inter-temporal component. The following methodology was used to arrive at the minutes spent across the 25 recorded activities:
  • Using the MTUS simple dataset, the sample was restricted to individuals aged between 15-64.
  • The minutes spent on each activity were weighted by the ‘propwt’ variable which brings the sample in line with the population from which it was drawn and ensures only good quality diaries are used. More information on the construction of ‘propwt’ can be found here: https://www.timeuse.org/sites/default/files/9727/chapter-5-weights-in-mtus.pdf
  • To calculate the mean number of minutes spent on an activity in a country in a given year, we took an average of the number of minutes spent on each of the 25 activities reported by the diarists. All diary entries where no minutes are recorded for certain activity are treated as missing and are not included in the calculated average.
  • The data is normalised to 1440 minutes per day. In other words, for those countries for which the time use does not sum up to 1440 minutes after weighting and averaging, the missing minutes are equally distributed across all activities.
Please see Table 1.1 for a list of all the surveys and years included: https://www.timeuse.org/sites/default/files/9727/mtus-user-guide-r9-february-2016.pdf

97575.name: Minutes spent commuting (MTUS (2013))
97575.description: Average minutes spent commuting. This includes travel to and from work, and education-related travel. Average minutes spent in different activities includes both weekdays and weekends.
97575.datasetName: Multinational Time Use Study (MTUS) - Gershuny and Fisher (2013)

More information on the construction of ‘propwt’ can be found here: https://www.timeuse.org/sites/default/files/9727/chapter-5-weights-in-mtus.pdf

Please see Table 1.1 for a list of all the surveys and years included: https://www.timeuse.org/sites/default/files/9727/mtus-user-guide-r9-february-2016.pdf

97576.name: Minutes spent on travel (MTUS (2013))
97576.description: Average minutes spent on travel include travel for voluntary/civic/religious activities, child/adult care-related travel, travel for shopping, personal or household care, and travelling for other purposes. Average minutes spent in different activities includes both weekdays and weekends.
97576.datasetName: Multinational Time Use Study (MTUS) - Gershuny and Fisher (2013)

97577.name: Minutes spent on sports or exercise (MTUS (2013))
97577.description: Average minutes spent on sports or exercise includes activities such as walking and cycling. Average minutes spent in different activities includes both weekdays and weekends.
97577.datasetName: Multinational Time Use Study (MTUS) - Gershuny and Fisher (2013)

97578.name: Minutes spent watching TV (MTUS (2013))
97578.description: Average minutes spent watching the TV or listening to the radio. This includes listening to music, iPod, CD, audio book, watching DVDs, including web streamed content. Average minutes spent in different activities includes both weekdays and weekends.
97578.datasetName: Multinational Time Use Study (MTUS) - Gershuny and Fisher (2013)

97579.description: Average minutes spent reading. Average minutes spent in different activities includes both weekdays and weekends.

97580.name: Minutes spent on computer (MTUS (2013))
97580.description: Average minutes spent on the computer including activities such as playing computer games, sending emails, surfing the internet, programming, and computing. Average minutes spent in different activities includes both weekdays and weekends.
97580.datasetName: Multinational Time Use Study (MTUS) - Gershuny and Fisher (2013)

97581.name: Minutes spent on out-of-home leisure (MTUS (2013))
97581.description: Average minutes spent on leisure outside of the home. This includes activities such as attending a sporting event, cinema, theatre, opera, concerts, other public events/venue, restaurants, cafes, bars, pubs, party, reception, social event, gambling, and imputed time away from home. Average minutes spent in different activities includes both weekdays and weekends.
97581.datasetName: Multinational Time Use Study (MTUS) - Gershuny and Fisher (2013)

97582.name: Minutes spent on leisure (MTUS (2013))
97582.description: Average minutes spent on leisure. Activities include receiving/visiting friends, conversation (in person, phone), games (social or solitary), other in-home social, general indoor leisure, artistic or musical activity, written correspondence, knit, crafts or hobbies, relaxing, thinking, doing nothing. Average minutes spent in different activities includes both weekdays and weekends.
97582.datasetName: Multinational Time Use Study (MTUS) - Gershuny and Fisher (2013)
